Package ohos.aafwk.ability.delegation

Interface IAbilityDelegator


  • public interface IAbilityDelegator
    A global test utility interface used for adding IAbilityMonitor objects and control lifecycle states of abilities.

    You can call addAbilityMonitor(java.lang.String) to add IAbilityMonitor objects to monitor the lifecycle states of specified abilities. You can also call method such as triggerClickEvent(ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability,ohos.agp.components.Component) to control the lifecycle states of abilities and dispatch input events.

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Aafwk#ABILITY

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int ACTIVE
      Indicates that the ability is in the active state.
      static int BACKGROUND
      Indicates that the ability is in the background state.
      static int INACTIVE
      Indicates that the ability is in the inactive state.
      static int INITIAL
      Indicates that the ability is in the initial state.
      static int UNDEFINED
      Indicates that the lifecycle state of the ability is not defined.

    • Method Detail

      • waitAbilityMonitor

        Optional<Ability> waitAbilityMonitor​(IAbilityMonitor monitor)
        Waits for and returns the Ability object that matches the conditions set in the given IAbilityMonitor.

        If a matched ability is successfully obtained, the specified IAbilityMonitor object becomes invalid. Otherwise, you can continue to use it in waitAbilityMonitor(ohos.aafwk.ability.delegation.IAbilityMonitor) or waitAbilityMonitor(ohos.aafwk.ability.delegation.IAbilityMonitor,long) to obtain abilities.

        Parameters:
        monitor - Indicates the IAbilityMonitor object used for monitoring lifecycle state changes of an ability.
        Returns:
        Returns an Optional object containing the Ability object if its lifecycle state has changed and it matches the given monitor; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • waitAbilityMonitor

        Optional<Ability> waitAbilityMonitor​(IAbilityMonitor monitor,
                                     long timeout)
        Waits for and returns the Ability object that matches the conditions set in the given IAbilityMonitor within the specified time period.

        If a matched ability is successfully obtained, the specified IAbilityMonitor object becomes invalid. Otherwise, you can continue to use it in waitAbilityMonitor(ohos.aafwk.ability.delegation.IAbilityMonitor) or waitAbilityMonitor(ohos.aafwk.ability.delegation.IAbilityMonitor,long) to obtain abilities.

        Parameters:
        monitor - Indicates the IAbilityMonitor object used for monitoring lifecycle state changes of an ability.
        timeout - Indicates the maximum amount of time to wait, in milliseconds. The value must be a positive integer.
        Returns:
        Returns an Optional object containing the Ability object if its lifecycle state has changed and it matches the given monitor; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • startAbilitySync

        Optional<Ability> startAbilitySync​(Intent intent)
        Starts an ability based on the given Intent and waits for 2 seconds for the ability to start running before returning.

        If no ability is started within 2 seconds, an empty Optional object will be returned.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Intent for starting the ability.
        Returns:
        Returns an Optional object containing the started Ability object if it is started successfully within 2 seconds; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • runOnUIThreadSync

        boolean runOnUIThreadSync​(Runnable task)
        Runs a specified task on the UI thread and blocks the thread until the task is complete.
        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the Runnable task to run.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the task executed successfully on the UI thread; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • startAbilitySync

        Optional<Ability> startAbilitySync​(Intent intent,
                                   long timeout)
        Starts an ability based on the given Intent and waits for a specified time period for the ability to start running before returning.

        If no ability is started within the time specified by timeout, an empty Optional object will be returned.

        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the Intent for starting the ability.
        timeout - Indicates the maximum amount of time to wait, in milliseconds. The value must be a positive integer.
        Returns:
        Returns an Optional object containing the started Ability object if it is started successfully within the specified time; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • stopAbility

        boolean stopAbility​(Ability ability)
        Destroys a specified ability.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the Ability object to destroy.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ability is successfully destroyed; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • triggerTouchEvent

        boolean triggerTouchEvent​(Ability ability,
                          TouchEvent touchEvent)
        Dispatches a touch event to the given ability and waits for it to be processed.

        This method is synchronous and cannot be run on the UI thread. Otherwise, the UI thread will be suspended.

        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the Ability object.
        touchEvent - Indicates the touch event to dispatch.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the touch event is successfully dispatched; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • triggerClickEvent

        boolean triggerClickEvent​(Ability ability,
                          Component component)
        Dispatches a click event to the specified Component object of the given ability and waits for it to be processed.

        This method is synchronous and cannot be run on the UI thread. Otherwise, the UI thread will be suspended.

        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the Ability object.
        component - Indicates the component of the ability to click.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the click event is successfully dispatched; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • triggerKeyEvent

        boolean triggerKeyEvent​(Ability ability,
                        KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Dispatches a key event to the given ability and waits for it to be processed.

        This method is synchronous and cannot be run on the UI thread. Otherwise, the UI thread will be suspended.

        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the Ability object.
        keyEvent - Indicates the key event to dispatch.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the key event is successfully dispatched; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

        int getAbilityState​(Ability ability)
        Obtains the lifecycle state of a specified ability.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the Ability object whose state is to be obtained.
        Returns:
        Returns the state of the ability, which can be UNDEFINED and so on.

        Parameters:

        Since:

      • println

        Prints log information to the unit testing console and automatically wraps lines.

        The total length of the log information to be printed, including the newline characters, cannot exceed 1000 characters.

        Parameters:
        msg - Indicates the log information to print.
        Since:
        4

        Returns:
        Returns the ability that is currently being displayed.
        Since:
        3

      • doAbilitySliceStop

        boolean doAbilitySliceStop​(Ability ability)
        Stops the active AbilitySlice on the specified Ability currently displayed on the UI.

        Do not run this method in the UI thread. Otherwise, the UI thread will be suspended. If the specified ability has only one ability slice, this method is asynchronously executed and the ability is directly destroyed. If there are multiple ability slices in the specified ability, this method is synchronously executed. In this case, it stops the currently displayed ability slice and then activates the ability slice at the top of the AbilitySlice stack.

        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the ability that hosts the ability slice to stop. This parameter cannot be null, and the ability must be in the ACTIVE state and contains at least one ability slice.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ability slice is successfully stopped; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • doAbilitySliceStart

        boolean doAbilitySliceStart​(Ability ability,
                            AbilitySlice targetSlice)
        Starts a specified AbilitySlice on the specified Ability currently displayed on the UI.

        Do not run this method in the UI thread. Otherwise, the UI thread will be suspended.

        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the ability that hosts the ability slice to start. This parameter cannot be null, and the ability must be in the ACTIVE state and contains at least one ability slice.
        targetSlice - Indicates the target ability slice. This parameter cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ability slice is successfully started; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getAbilitySliceState

        int getAbilitySliceState​(AbilitySlice targetSlice)
        Obtains the lifecycle state of a specified ability slice.
        Parameters:
        targetSlice - Indicates the AbilitySlice object whose state is to be obtained.
        Returns:
        Returns the state of the ability slice, which can be UNDEFINED and so on.
        Since:
        3

      • isAbilityHasSlice

        Returns:

        Since:

      • isSliceStackEmpty

        boolean isSliceStackEmpty​(Ability ability)
        Checks whether the ability slice stack in the specified ability is empty.

        The ability slice stack is considered empty if the ability to check contains only one or no ability slice.

        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the Ability object to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the ability slice stack is empty; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

        Returns:

        Since:
